thread.title: Golf: CAK’s Davis Shore trails by two shots - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Golf: CAK’s Davis Shore trails by two shots - PrepXtra Story

author: News Sentinel staff
title: Golf: CAK’s Davis Shore trails by two shots - PrepXtra
text:
Davis Shore is in position to make a run at his second consecutive state golf title.
Shore, a Christian Academy of Knoxville junior, is tied for fifth with Kingston's Brady Davis after firing an even-par 72 during the opening round of the TSSAA Class A/AA boys state golf tournament at WillowBrook Golf Club in Manchester on Tuesday.
The reigning PrepXtra Player of the Year and Alabama commitment, who won state medalist honors as a sophomore in 2014, rolled off three birdies on the front nine, working around a double bogey on No. 5. He also dropped a shot on No. 12 before making par on his final six holes.
Shore and Davis, who posted two birdies and two bogeys, trail Lipscomb's Davis Armstrong by two strokes heading into Wednesday's final round.
Grace Christian's Luke Scealf, tied for seventh, shot 73, and CAK's Tyler Young and McMinn Central's John Houk are tied for 22nd at 79.
Sullivan South took the team lead at 17-over 305. CAK is third at 315, and McMinn Central is eighth at 358.
CAK's Emma Wasson, second among girls, opened with a 77, and trails defending champion Siarra Stout of Christ Presbyterian Academy by three shots.
CAK's Caroline Cavin and Kingston's Kristen Ankrom are tied for fourth after posting 81, and Kingston's Savannah Szozda is tied for 10th at 82.
Northview Academy's Heidi Lawson (14th, 85), Sequoyah's Carly Swabe (T20, 90) and McMinn Central's Mattie Cardin (T25, 92) represent other area standouts.
Defending champion CPA leads the girls division at 12-over 156. CAK is second at 158, and Northview Academy is eighth at 198.
